citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A dog was identified at the facility needing veterinary care. The facility did not identify the issue prior to the inspection. An
approximately 9 week old female Springer Doodle (#8076) was found to have two abrasions near the vulva measuring
approximately ½ inch. The outer edges of the abrasions were irregular, pink with crusting, and the inside appeared moist.
The facility states the animal did not appear to be irritated by the site. Failure to conduct adequate daily observations to
assess the health and well-being of the animals with direct and frequent communication to the attending veterinarian can
delay treatment leading to the condition getting worse and delays in healing. Each dealer shall establish and maintain
programs of adequate veterinary care that include daily observation of all animals to assess their health and well-being
and that a mechanism of direct and frequent communication is required so that timely and accurate information on
problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being is conveyed to the attending veterinarian. Correct by ensuring that
the animal is examined and treated by a licensed veterinarian. Correct by 31-JULY-2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A dog was identified at the facility needing veterinary care. The facility did not identify the issue prior to the inspection. An 
approximately 9 week old female Springer Doodle (#8076) was found to have two abrasions near the vulva measuring 
approximately ½ inch. The outer edges of the abrasions were irregular, pink with crusting, and the inside appeared moist. 
The facility states the animal did not appear to be irritated by the site. Failure to conduct adequate daily observations to 
assess the health and well-being of the animals with direct and frequent communication to the attending veterinarian can 
delay treatment leading to the condition getting worse and delays in healing. Each dealer shall establish and maintain 
programs of adequate veterinary care that include daily observation of all animals to assess their health and well-being 
and that a mechanism of direct and frequent communication is required so that timely and accurate information on 
problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being is conveyed to the attending veterinarian. Correct by ensuring that 
the animal is examined and treated by a licensed veterinarian. Correct by 31-JULY-2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
